  • Software design, development and maintenance based on the existing components of a hosted application
Technologies we work with:

C#, .Net 8, Azure Cloud, Git, TFS, Visual Studio, Rider

What we expect from you:
  • Experience in basic Azure concepts
  • Good knowledge of C# language
  • A deep understanding of .NET platform, data structures and algorithms
  • Possession of the principles of software design and development
  • English proficiency sufficient to communicate with international teams
We offer:

Join our dynamic and innovative team at Veeam Software as we expand our presence in Poland! While we finalize our Benefits offerings, we are committed to supporting you with a monthly benefit stipend, ensuring your well-being during this exciting journey with Veeam Software.

Please note: If the applicant is permanently present outside of Poland, Veeam reserves the right to refuse to consider the application for a job. Remote job is only possible in case the employee is located in Poland.

#LI-DZ1

Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.

By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

title: Senior Developer
description:
Job Summary 

We are seeking a highly skilled and proactive Senior Developer to join our team and contribute to the full software development lifecycle. The ideal candidate will bring strong back-end and full-stack experience, an understanding of legacy systems, and leadership in technical mentorship. While ColdFusion experience is a plus, it is not required — we welcome developers who are excited to learn and support legacy technologies alongside modern stacks.

This is a remote, U.S.-based role, preferably located in the Eastern time zone, working within a collaborative Agile team to support ongoing sprint development, new feature delivery, and modernization efforts.

Responsibilities 

  • Lead and contribute to the design, development, testing, and deployment of scalable web applications and features.

  • Work closely with the Product Development Manager to align sprint work with roadmap goals (approx. 60% development, 20% support, 20% ceremonies/meetings).

  • Provide mentorship and technical guidance to junior developers; act as a subject matter expert (SME) across the stack.

  • Collaborate with QA, support, and product teams to triage and resolve issues.

  • Participate in peer code reviews and contribute to the team’s technical knowledge base.

  • Support legacy applications (e.g., ColdFusion) while contributing to modernization efforts.

  • Participate in Agile ceremonies and help improve team processes and coding standards.

  • Help maintain database performance through optimized stored procedures and SQL design.

  • Set up and maintain a local development environment and contribute to DevOps practices via GitLab CI/CD pipelines, AWS services, and Docker containers.

Requirements 

  • 5+ years of professional software development experience
  • 5 years of expereince with PHP
  • 2-3 years of experience with .NET &C# 
  • Strong proficiency in MS SQL (T-SQL), JavaScript, AJAX, JQuery 
  • Experince with SQL Server, stored procedures, and database design 
  • Experince with Git/Gitlab, CI/CD, AWS, Docker, and monolithic systems 
  • Understanding of REST/SOAP APIS, IIS/Apache web servers, and security best practices (PCI, SOC, OWASP)
  • Exposure to ColdFusion is a plus 
  • Comfortable working in Agile/Scrum environments  

Other Skills & Attributes 

  • High standards of work ethic, detail orientation, and accountability.

  • Strong time management and prioritization skills.

  • Ability to independently drive work, mentor peers, and contribute to team success.

Excited about this role but don’t meet every single requirement?  Studies have shown that women and other marginalized groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification.  At Togetherwork we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.  You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

The Company offers a comprehensive employee benefits program, including:

  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance options 
  • 100% Employer paid short/long term disability
  • Basic Life 
  • 401(k) option with 100% company match up to 4%
  • Flexible paid personal/vacation time built on mutual trust and accountability
  • 10 sick days annually 
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • 6 weeks paid parental leave

Inclusion and Diversity: Togetherwork is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We are a company where diverse backgrounds, experiences and viewpoints are valued. Togetherwork does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, age, ethnic or national origin, or any other basis protected by all local, state or federal laws. 

Salary Range Disclosure

The base range represents the low and high end of the Togetherwork salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary and may be above or below the range based on factors including, but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Togetherwork's total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include discretionary bonuses, long term incentives, a flexible paid vacation/personal time policy, 6 weeks paid parental leave and more.

Salary Range

US Remote: $100,000- $104,000

Togetherwork provides integrated software and financial solutions to a wide range of communities and organizations including associations, camps, unions, fraternities & sororities, gyms, dance studios, religious congregations, pet services, and more.

Our mission-critical tools help our customers manage and grow their communities, and enhance the depth and breadth of their member engagement. Our team is united in its desire to help our clients better serve and empower their communities.

This role is supporting our Municipalities Vertical Solution: https://www.togetherwork.com/vertical-solutions/municipalities/

title: Senior Backend Engineer
description:
Who are we?
Hi! We're Bee Talents, an IT recruitment agency that has been helping clients from all around the world in building their technical teams since 2015. Today, we would like to invite you to participate in the recruitment process for Alfreð.
 
Alfreð, Iceland’s own portal for job-seekers and employers alike, is the largest platform of its kind in the Icelandic employment market. Established in 2013 and with 20 people onboard, Alfreð quickly became one of the most popular labor-centric solutions in a market that - until then - had a limited online presence. Their portal and its corresponding app serve as a link between employers and prospective employees by matching new opportunities with the skills of a particular user, making the job hunt efficient and simple for the persons involved. 
 
We’re looking for an experienced and dedicated Senior Backend (Java/Kotlin) Engineer with a great understanding of microservices architecture. 
 
What Alfreð can offer you:
💰 Salary: 22k-26k net on B2B (0% VAT)
⏱  Working hours: flexible (typically between 8:00 and 18:00)
✅ 30 days of paid vacation
📍 Office location(s): (none in Poland) Reykjavík, Iceland and Prague, Czech Republik and others
👩‍💻 Working mode: fully remote in Poland (or hybrid in Iceland or in Czech Republic) in a small development team
💻 Equipment: you can buy your own (preferably Macbook) and Alfreð will reimburse it (FV 0% VAT) or they can send you theirs
🇬🇧 Speaking language: English as we international working environment
🛠️ Techstack/Skills/Methodology: Java, Kotlin, Spring, Spring Boot, Hibernate, MySQL, Google Cloud Platform, Microservices, TDD + DevOps, Docker, Kubernetes, Github i Scrum. PS From the front-end side (not needed here) - React.js, TypeScript & Next.js. 
 



Your tasks from the "0" day will be i. e.:
  • familiarizing with processes, code and architecture,
  • responsibility for the Alfreð brand products, which includes both creating new features and maintaining the existing ones,
  • improving existing solutions in order to make them more scalable,
  • testing and focusing on the quality code,
  • configuring and monitoring deployments and suggesting and implementing improvements to the setup.



What we expect from you:
  • min. 5 years of commercial experience as a Back-End engineer, in which 3 years in Java/Kotlin,
  • proven track record in designing IaaC services and systems that involve multiple microservices,
  • experience in implementing and suggesting new solutions in the field of architecture,
  • experience in building cloud products (it doesn't matter which one; Alfreð uses GCP) and testing (Alfreð loves Test Driven Development!),
  • experience with relational and non-relational databases (MySQL, Firebase etc.),
  • experience with distributed systems,
  • experience with Kubernetes is preferred,
  • min. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering.
Sound interesting? Let's talk!
 
BEE TALENTS INFORMATION CLAUSE ⬇️
The Administrator of your personal data is Bee Talents PSA, ul. Królowej Jadwigi 43, 61-871, Poznan, NIP: 7792463296.
